steps.title: Boil the kettle.
steps.content: Boil the kettle. Place 1 teaspoon of dried anise leaf or 3 teaspoons of fresh, crushed anise leaf or leaves into one cup of boiling water.

steps.title: Allow to steep for a few minutes.
steps.content: Allow to steep for a few minutes. It is now ready to serve.

steps.title: Crush or grind 1 tablespoon of anise seeds.
steps.content: Crush or grind 1 tablespoon of anise seeds. A mortar and pestle is a good instrument for this purpose.

steps.title: Add 2 cups of boiling water to a saucepan.
steps.content: Add 2 cups of boiling water to a saucepan. Add the crushed seeds. Simmer gently for 5 to minutes.

steps.title: Serve.
steps.content: Serve. It is now ready to serve as it is. However, you may wish to add milk, as with ordinary tea. seeds :

steps.title: Crush the anise seeds if you haven’t done so already.
steps.content: Crush the anise seeds if you haven’t done so already. This releases their fragrant oils and makes certain that the tea will taste marvelous.

steps.title: Place the crushed anise seeds into the intended mug or cup.
steps.content: Place the crushed anise seeds into the intended mug or cup.

steps.title: Pour the boiling water into the cup.
steps.content: Pour the boiling water into the cup.

steps.title: Allow to steep for 10 to 15 minutes.
steps.content: Allow to steep for 10 to 15 minutes. Yes, the tea will cool but the flavor depth will benefit greatly from a long steeping time. Once it is has steeped sufficiently, it is ready to serve.

steps.title: Substitute the water in any of the above recipes with warm milk.
steps.content: Substitute the water in any of the above recipes with warm milk. Anise tea can be particularly delicious if it is brewed using warm milk instead of the water. Made with milk, it is an ideal drink to enjoy just before going to bed, as anise is reputed to induce sleep. [3] X Research source
